title: Lower Yoke and Headstock Bearings - Removal

body.body: Lower Yoke and Headstock Bearings - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

Care must be taken when removing the upper yoke and top nut, to make sure that the top nut and headstock do not become scratched. Protect the surfaces with a suitable cloth or tape to prevent scratching.
, remove the lock nut and tab washer. Discard the tab washer.
Using the same tool, remove the adjuster nut.
Remove the lower yoke from below the frame headstock.

Always wear eye, hand and face protection when using a hammer and drift. Use of a hammer and drift can cause bearings to fragment. Pieces of fragmented bearing could cause eye and soft tissue injuries if suitable protective apparel is not worn.
Using a suitable drift, evenly and progressively drive the bearing races from the frame headstock.
Remove the inner race and dust seal from the lower yoke using a press or puller.
